BiblioData.Title: SOFT MEMS

Applicant.Name: UNIV ILLINOIS [US]
THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS

BiblioData.Abstract: A microscale polymer-based apparatus comprises a substrate formed from a first polymer material and at least one active region integrated with the substrate. The at least one active region is patterned from a second polymer material that is modified to perform at least one function within the at least one active region.

Claims.P: CLAIMS
WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:

1. A microscale polymer-based apparatus comprising: a substrate formed from a first polymer material; at least one active region integrated with said substrate, said at least one active region being patterned from a second polymer material; wherein the second polymer material is modified to perform at least one function within said at least one active region.
2. The apparatus of claim 1 , wherein the second polymer material comprises a composite polymer material including the first polymer material and at least one additive.
3. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the first polymer material is substantially nonconductive, and the second polymer material is modified to be conductive.
4. The apparatus of claim 3, wherein said at least one active region is embedded within said substrate.
5. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein said at least one active region comprises at least one of an electrode, an embedded strain gauge, a conductive sensor, and a heater.
6. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein said substrate comprises a non-conductive sheet, and wherein said at least one active region comprises at least one embedded strain gauge.
7. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein said substrate includes a microfluidic channel formed therein, and wherein said at least one active region comprises at least one conductive flow rate sensor.
8. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein said substrate includes a microfluidic channel formed therein, and wherein said at least one active region comprises at least one resistive heater.

9. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein said substrate includes a plurality of nonconductive layers, and wherein said at least one active region comprises a plurality of active regions, each of said plurality of nonconductive layers including a plurality of active regions.

10. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein said substrate includes a plurality of nonconductive layers; wherein said at least one active region comprises a plurality of embedded electrodes, each of said plurality of nonconductive layers including a plurality of embedded electrodes; wherein the embedded electrodes are arranged orthogonally with respect to adjacent nonconductive layers to provide a capacitive array.

11. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein said at least one active region comprises a plurality of active regions embedded within said substrate such that each of the plurality of active regions are separated from one another by a portion of said substrate.
12. The apparatus of claim 3, further comprising: at least one electrical contact electrically coupled to said at least one active region.
13. The apparatus of claim 2, wherein the first polymer material comprises an elastomer, and wherein the second polymer material comprises an elastomer modified to become conductive.
14. The apparatus of claim 2, wherein the first polymer material comprises polydimethlysiloxane (PDMS), and wherein the second polymer material comprises PDMS modified to become conductive.
15. The apparatus of claim 14, wherein the second polymer material comprises PDMS combined with multiwall carbon nanotubes
(MWNT).

16. A method of forming a microscale polymer-based device, the method comprising: patterning a photoresist on a substrate to provide a photoresist mold; applying a modified polymer to the photoresist mold to form at least one modified polymer structure; removing said patterned photoresist; forming nonmodified polymer around the at least one modified polymer structure to provide a nonmodified polymer structure and capture the at least one modified polymer structure within the nonmodified polymer structure; and releasing the at least one modified polymer structure and the nonmodified polymer structure from the substrate.
17. The method of claim 16 wherein the modified polymer comprises the nonmodified polymer and an additive to make the modified polymer conductive.

18. The method of claim 17, wherein the nonmodif[iota]ed polymer comprises polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS), and wherein the modified polymer comprises PDMS combined with multiwall carbon nanorubes (MWNT).

19. The method of claim 16, wherein the at least one modified polymer structure comprises at least one of an electrode, a flow sensor, a heater, strain gauge, a capacitor plate, a chemical sensor, a biosensor, and a porous region.

20. An integrated, polymer-based structure comprising: a modified polymer-based means; a non-modified polymer-based means integrated with said modified polymer-based means, said modified polymer-based means being patterned in or on said non-modified polymer-based means to provide one or more active regions.
